document.docAuthor: Rafael, José Albertino & Marques, Dayse Willkenia Almeida
document.docTitle: Macrostomus trilineatus Rafael & Marques 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Five new species of Macrostomus Wiedemann and a checklist of Empididae (s. str.) (Diptera) from Bolivia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Five new species of Macrostomus Wiedemann and a checklist of Empididae (s. str.) (Diptera) from Bolivia

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Thorax shiny yellow with a mid-longitudinal black stripe from pronotum to level of transverse suture, between dorsocentral row of setae and paired submedian black stripes from anterior dorsocentral seta to scutoscutellar suture; tergite 8 with a short projection posteriorly, with apex rounded and longer setae surrounding and on the projection; posterodorsal lobe of epandrium with two stouter spatulate apical setae; anterior cercus multilobate.

Type material examined.
HOLOTYPE
♂ : “ BOLIVIA , La Paz , Chulumani , cloud forest above
2000 m
”; “ Chulumani ,
29.vi.
[19]79”; “QR code: NHMUK 010864613 ”; “ Holotype ♂
Macrostomus trilineatus Rafael & Marques
” ( Fig. 13Q ) ( NHMUK ).
PARATYPE : Bolivia :
Same data as holotype , NHMUK 0 10864614 ( 1♂ , NHMUK , dissected)
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 14.
Macrostomus pictipennis (Bezzi)
and
M. limbipennis (Bezzi )
. A. Wing of
M. pictipennis
, specimen from Peru, Cusco, Quincemil (INPA); B–F.
M. limbipennis ;
B . Male terminalia, lateral view; C. Tergite and sternite 8, lateral view; D. Apex of abdomen, lateral view; E. Sternite 8, genital fork, genital chamber and spermatheca, ventral view. F. Sternite 8, ventral view in a different angle to show the sternite division. Scale bars, figures A = 1 mm; B = 0.3 mm; C–F = 0.2 mm. Abbreviations: GC, genital chamber; GF, genital fork; Spmth, spermatheca; St, sternite; Tg, tergite.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype condition.
Pinned, double mounted. Abdomen dissected, in microvial with glycerin.
Etymology. From the Latin tri = three and linea = line, which refers to the three longitudinal stripes on the scutum.
Variation. Paratype specimen with thoracic submedian black stripe ending before scutoscutellar suture and all stripes narrower.

Remarks . Characters allowing a well-founded placement are presently not available for
M. trilineatus
sp. nov.
It differs remarkably from other known
Macrostomus
species by the epandrium posterodorsal lobe with two stouter spatulate apical spine-like setae, by the presence of a small sclerite between anterodorsal lobe of epandrium and anterior cercus (not seen in other
Macrostomus
species). On the basis of the black longitudinal stripes on the thorax of
M. trilineatus
sp. nov.
, this species appears related to
M. lineatus Rafael & Cumming, 2006
described from Ecuador and Peru . It differs by the three longitudinal black stripes on the scutum (versus one mid-longitudinal black stripe in
M. lineatus
); tergite 8 projected distally (versus somewhat elongate and bifid); hypandrium wider distally and without medial projection (versus narrow distally, with medial posterior projection).
